customConfig.name: pageMargin
customConfig.label: Page margin
customConfig.note: Use of "vmin" units are recommended; also use others.

customConfig.name: pageWidth
customConfig.label: Page width
customConfig.note: This option does not apply to the front page.

customConfig.name: entryWidth
customConfig.label: Post entry width
customConfig.note: Set the maximum width for a blog post; "rem" units are recommended; but others (em, px) may also be used

customConfig.name: frontPost
customConfig.label: Posts
customConfig.note: We strongly recommended 'hide' and 'noindex' the selected post to avoid the duplicate content issue.

customConfig.name: frontGallery
customConfig.note: Enable if you want to display a post with image gallery

customConfig.name: sliderItemsAmount
customConfig.label: Number of slides
customConfig.note: The minimum number of slides should not be less than 2

customConfig.name: sliderItemExcluded
customConfig.label: Exclude posts
customConfig.note: Enter a post ID, or IDs separated by comma

customConfig.name: sliderItemOffset
customConfig.label: Offset
customConfig.note: Specify number of posts to pass over

customConfig.name: includeFeaturedInPosts
customConfig.label: Include featured posts
customConfig.note: Include/exclude featured posts from the front page post list; excluding, prevents duplicate content when featured posts are displayed by the slider.

customConfig.name: sliderTitle
customConfig.label: Title
customConfig.note: Show post title

customConfig.name: sliderMainTag
customConfig.label: Main tag
customConfig.note: Show main tag below the title

customConfig.name: sliderAuthor
customConfig.label: Author
customConfig.note: Show author below the title

customConfig.name: sliderDate
customConfig.label: Date
customConfig.note: Show date below the title

customConfig.name: sliderImageHeight
customConfig.label: Image height
customConfig.note: Use of VH units recommended but you can also use others (rem, em, px, ...)

customConfig.name: sliderLoop
customConfig.label: Loop
customConfig.note: Moves throughout all the slides seamlessly

customConfig.name: sliderSpeed
customConfig.label: Speed
customConfig.note: Adjust scroll speed; a higher number enables faster scrolling. Drag interactions are not affected because speed is then determined by the drag force.

customConfig.name: sliderDraggable
customConfig.label: Draggable
customConfig.note: Enables for scrolling the carousel with mouse and touch interactions.

customConfig.name: sliderDraggFree
customConfig.label: Dragg free
customConfig.note: Enables momentum scrolling. The speed and duration of the continued scrolling is proportional to how vigorous the drag gesture is.

customConfig.name: sliderAutoplayTimeout
customConfig.label: Autoplay timeout
customConfig.note: Autoplay timeout in milliseconds (1000ms = 1s)

customConfig.name: sliderProgressBar
customConfig.label: Progress bar
customConfig.note: Show progress bar

customConfig.name: sliderCounter
customConfig.label: Slider Counter
customConfig.note: Show current and total slides

customConfig.name: sidebarSticky
customConfig.label: Sticky sidebar
customConfig.note: Make sidebar sticky on scroll.

customConfig.name: tagsFeaturedImage
customConfig.label: Display featured images
customConfig.note: Enable / disable tag featured image

customConfig.name: submenuWidth
customConfig.note: The submenu width in PX unit

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.label: Cards
customConfig.note: A card is an object that includes post elements such as the title, image, author or date; cards are displayed on the frontpage, tag, tags and author pages, also in the related posts section.

customConfig.name: colorScheme
customConfig.label: Select color scheme
customConfig.note:
The auto color scheme means that it automatically adjusted to fit the user's operating system settings; if the OS does not support this feature, the light version is used.

To change or create your own color scheme go to the Light color scheme or Dark color scheme tab.

customConfig.name: fontFamily
customConfig.label: Font family
customConfig.note:
The 'OS Default Font' option will use the native system fonts of the browser your site visitors are using, providing a boost to speed and performance.

Please note: when using Google Fonts, the IP address of your website visitors will be sent to Google to allow the correct fonts to be downloaded to their browser. The Google Fonts API limits the collection, storage and use of end-user data only to what is needed to deliver the fonts efficiently.

options.label: OS Default Font + OS Default Font
Source Serif Pro + OS Default Font

customConfig.name: minFontSize
customConfig.label: Minimum font size
customConfig.note: The font-size of the root element in REM unit

customConfig.name: maxFontSize
customConfig.label: Maximum font size
customConfig.note: The font-size of the root element in REM unit

customConfig.name: lineHeight
customConfig.label: Line height
customConfig.note: The default line-height for the entire website

customConfig.name: separator
customConfig.label: Headings
customConfig.note: Please note: not all of the font weights are working with the fonts listed above.

customConfig.name: shareTwitterName
customConfig.note: Enter your Twitter account's handle here; it will be used when the Twitter share button is clicked on your site e.g. 'via @TwitterHandle'. If left blank, the default username of @SiteName will be used

customConfig.name: commentDisqusShortname
customConfig.label: Disqus shortname
customConfig.note:
A shortname is the unique identifier assigned to a Disqus site. Please visit https://help.disqus.com/ to find more details.

Do not forget to enable comments under Post options tab.

customConfig.name: searchId
customConfig.label: Google Custom Search Id
customConfig.note: A search ID is required for search functionality, which uses Google Custom Search. Learn how to configure it here: https://www.getpublii.com/docs/...

customConfig.name: searchParam
customConfig.label: Search parameter
customConfig.note: You can change the default "q" search parameter if desired; this is recommended only for advanced users.

customConfig.name: footerNewsletterMailchimpURL
customConfig.label: Form action URL
customConfig.note: Find your form action URL

customConfig.name: footerNewsletterFormCode
customConfig.note: Before pasting your code, learn how to make your newsletter form as functional and visually-appealing as possible. Learn more

customConfig.name: galleryItemGap
customConfig.label: Item spacing
customConfig.note: Use of REM units recommended but you can also use others (px, vw,)

customConfig.name: galleryLightboxStyle
customConfig.label: Lightbox style
customConfig.note: Set the lightbox slideshow style by choosing dark or light overlay

customConfig.name: galleryLightboxOpacity
customConfig.note: Adjust the lightbox overlay transparency

customConfig.name: galleryPreloader
customConfig.label: Preloader
customConfig.note: Loading indicator is displayed with 1s delay, so if the photo loads faster it will be invisible.

customConfig.name: galleryCloseOnScroll
customConfig.label: Close gallery on page scroll
customConfig.note: Option works just for devices without hardware touch support.

customConfig.name: galleryArrowKeys
customConfig.label: Keyboard navigation
customConfig.note: Keyboard left or right arrow key navigation.

customConfig.name: codeMaxHeight
customConfig.label: Max. height
customConfig.note: Specify the maximum height of the <pre> tag; you can use any units (px, vw, rem, em ...)

customConfig.name: pagePrefetching
customConfig.label: On / Off
customConfig.note: Speeds-up page-loads after the initial load by prefetching in-viewport links during idle time. When enabled, it will check the current browser window for any links, then, if the browser isn't doing anything and the user isn't on a slow connection, it will start pre-loading the linked URLs so that the content will be ready when the link is clicked.

customConfig.note: More details you can find here.

customConfig.name: lazyLoadEffect
customConfig.label: Lazy load effects
